page_type.description: The first page of a document, usually found at the beginning of periodicals. It often features large graphic elements, prominent titles, and key information about the publication. Examples include magazine covers or the title page of a research paper.
Pages that introduce the content of the document. This may include prefaces, forewords, abstracts, or executive summaries.
A list of the main sections, chapters, or articles in the document, usually with corresponding page numbers.
A catalog of all figures, illustrations, or images used in the document, typically with corresponding page numbers.
An index of all tables used in the document, usually with corresponding page numbers.
A typical page within the main body of the document. These usually appear between the introductory and concluding sections and contain the primary content.
A page containing a self-contained piece of writing, often found in magazines, newspapers, or academic journals.
Pages primarily featuring charts, graphs, or other visual representations of data.
In research papers, a section detailing the methods and procedures used in the study.
In research papers, a section presenting the findings or outcomes of the study.
In research papers, a section interpreting the results and relating them to existing literature.
The final section of a document, summarizing key points and providing closure.
Supplementary material that is too detailed for the main body of the work but relevant to the document.
Pages containing citations and sources used in the document.

page_sub_type.description: A list of all sources directly referenced in the document, typically following a specific citation style.
A comprehensive list of all sources consulted during research, including those not directly cited in the document.
Similar to works cited, a list of sources referenced in the document, often used interchangeably with bibliography in some citation styles.

page_type.description: An alphabetical list of key terms, concepts, or names mentioned in the document, along with their page numbers.
A list of specialized or technical terms used in the document, along with their definitions.
